name: GJ 1214
scenarioDescription:
The GJ 1214 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 1214 is a star with 0.15 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.22 times its radius. It is located 47.78 light years away from the solar system.

GJ 1214 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 1214 system


GJ 1214 b

GJ 1214 b was discovered by the MEarth Project observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.01 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 1214 b is 6.2646 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 1214 b is 2.847 that of Earth. At 6.2646 Earth masses, GJ 1214 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system GJ 1214, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by MEarth Project.
